document.docAuthor: Sankaran, Pradeep M., Malamel, Jobi J., Joseph, Mathew M. & Sebastian, Pothalil A.
document.masterDocTitle: An updated review of the genus Martensopoda Jäger, 2006 (Araneae: Sparassidae: Heteropodinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An updated review of the genus Martensopoda Jäger, 2006 (Araneae: Sparassidae: Heteropodinae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Heteropoda minuscula
Reimoser, 1934
: 485
, fig. 9 (description and illustration of female).
Spariolenus minusculus (Reimoser)
.
Jäger 2002
: 58
, figs 134–137 (designation of lectotype and paralectotype , transfer of female from
Heteropoda
to

).

Martensopoda minuscula (Reimoser)
.
Jäger 2006
: 341
, figs 13 –25, 29– 30 (description and illustration of female, transfer of female from
Spariolenus
to
Martensopoda
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. INDIA : Kerala:
1 male
(with left legs III, IV and right leg IV missing), Pathanamthitta, Gavi,
9 o 26 '09.07''N
,
77 o09' 56.78 ''E
, 1201 m ,
21 December 2013
, M.S. Pradeep leg. by hand ( ADSH 920134 B);
1 female
, same data as for male specimen ( ADSH 920234 B);
1 female
, Idukki, Pampadum Shola National Park,
10 o08' 54.66 ''N
,
77 o 15 ' 33.62 ''E
, 1832 m , 0
2 January 2014
, M.S. Pradeep leg. by hand ( ADSH 920334 B).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 4A–J.
Martensopoda minuscula (Reimoser, 1934)
. A–B Male habitus (A dorsal, B ventral); C–F Male left pedipalp (C prolateral, D ventral, E retrolateral, F dorsal); G–H Female habitus (G dorsal, H ventral); I Epigyne, ventral view; J Vulva, dorsal view.

FIGURES 5A–E.
Martensopoda minuscula (Reimoser, 1934)
. Male left pedipalp (A entire prolateral, B enlarged prolateral, C ventral, D retrolateral, E dorsal). Abbreviations: C conductor, E embolus, EA embolic apophysis, PB prolateral bulge of cymbium, RTA retrolateral tibial apophysis, SP spur of cymbium. Scale bars: A, 0.8 mm; B–E, 0.3 mm.

FIGURES 6A–B.
Martensopoda minuscula (Reimoser, 1934)
. A Epigyne, ventral view; B Vulva, dorsal view. Abbreviations: FD fertilization duct, LL lateral loops of internal duct system, MS median septum, PP pit posterior to septum, R spiral rim of copulatory opening. Scale bars: A–B, 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Male of
M. minuscula
is closely related to
M. transversa
, but can be separated by the following combination of characters: less prominent prolateral bulge of cymbium (
Figs 4 D
,
5 C
), in
M. transversa
, it is prominent (
Jäger 2006 : fig. 5
); embolus with a distal, oblique twist (
Figs 4 D
,
5 C
), which is absent in
M. transversa
(
Jäger 2006 : fig. 5
); wider conductor (
Fig 5 C
), in
M. transversa
, the conductor is reduced (
Jäger 2006 : fig. 5
); RTA short and directed at 1 -o’clock position (
Figs 4 D
,
5 C
), in
M. transversa
, RTA is long and directed at 11 -o’clock position (
Jäger 2006 : fig. 3
). Females can be separated from all other described congeners by the median part of the internal duct system, which appears as paired, longitudinal tubes and lying along the entire length of the median line (
Figs 4 J
,
6 B
), in
M. transversa
, it appears to be a median, flattened, longitudinal plate (
Jäger 2006 : fig. 10
) and in
M. sanctor
sp. nov.
, it is short and restricted to the posterior part of the median line (
Figs 1 J
,
3 B
).

Description. Male : Prosoma uniformly yellowish-brown with narrow reddish- brown striae radiating from sides of fovea and with dark, faint markings (
Figs 4 A–B
). Eye field yellowish-brown, hirsute; eyes with distinct dark patches. Clypeus, chelicerae, maxillae, labium, sternum yellowish-brown. Cheliceral promargin with 3 teeth, retromargin with 4 teeth; promargin provided with a row of long, curved hairs. Fang furrows provided proximally with a few denticles. Maxillae with reduced scopulae. Sternum without markings. Opisthosoma elongated oval, yellowish-brown, hirsute; dorsally and laterally with black shades. Spinnerets yellowish-brown. Leg segments yellowish-brown with inconspicuous dark brown patches; trochaters I–III notched; metatarsi I–III and tarsi I–III scopulated. Body length 6.43 . Prosoma length 3.60 , width 3.33 . Opisthosoma length 2.83 , width 1.85 . Eye diameters: AME 0.22 . ALE 0.39 . PME 0.26 . PLE 0.41 . Eye interdistances: AME–AME 0.18 . AME–ALE 0.05 . AME–PME 0.20 . ALE–PLE 0.28 . PME–PME 0.26 . PME–PLE 0.31 . Clypeus height at AME 0.26 , at ALE 0.21 . Chelicera length 1.30 . Measurements of palp and legs: Palp 5.25 [ 1.70 , 0.58 , 0.71 , 2.26 ], I 12.86 [ 3.68 , 1.57 , 3.37 , 3.04 , 1.20 ], II 14.67 [ 4.34 , 1.69 , 3.80 , 3.58 , 1.26 ], III (right leg) 11.9 [ 3.50 , 1.45 , 3.06 , 2.99 , 0.90 ], IV missing. Leg formula 213 ... Spination. Palp: femur 131 , patella 101 , tibia 2111 , tarsus 3000 ; legs: femora I–III 323 ; patellae I–III 001; tibiae
I–II 2026
,
III 2126
; metatarsi I–II 0 0 0 4 ,
III 2024
. Pedipalp (
Figs 4 C–F
,
5 A–E
): Palpal segments yellowish-brown. Embolus forming a distal narrow loop (
Figs 4 D
,
5 C
); tip of embolus directed at 1 -o’clock position (
Figs 4 D
,
5 C
); embolic apophysis separates distally from the embolus (
Figs 4 D
,
5 C
); tip of embolic apophysis serrated (
Figs 5 B–C
). Conductor wide, membranous, situated distally on the tegulum (
Fig 5 C
). RTA massive with a narrow tip, directed at 2 -o’clock position, with a short, disto-retrolateral branch (
Figs 4 E
,
5 D
). Cymbial spur slender, curved (
Figs 4 F
,
5 E
).

Redescription. Female: In all details like male except the following: Prosoma with dark, faint markings (
Figs 4 G–H
). Eye field not hirsute. Sternum with faint dark markings. Opisthosoma oval, grayish; venter provided with scattered, inconspicuous dark brown patches. Spinnerets grayish. All trochanters notched; metatarsus IV less scopulated; all other metatarsi and all tarsi with well developed scopulae. Body length 8.51 . Prosoma length 3.52 , width 3.26 . Opisthosoma length 4.99 , width 3.40 . Eyes diameter: AME 0.14 . ALE 0.18 . PME 0.16 . PLE 0.25 . Eye interdistance: AME–AME 0.12 . AME–ALE 0.07 . AME–PME 0.29 . ALE–PLE 0.31 . PME–PME 0.22 . PME–PLE 0.34 . Clypeus height at AME 0.19 , at ALE 0.17 . Chelicera length 1.48 . Measurements of palp and legs: Palp 4.51 [ 1.31 , 0.72 , 0.94 , 1.54 ], I 10.42 [ 2.86 , 1.47 , 2.61 , 2.53 , 0.95 ], II 11.18 [ 3.31 , 1.28 , 2.67 , 2.83 , 1.09 ], III 9.59 [ 3.13 , 1.40 , 2.32 , 2.00, 0.74 ], IV 10.97 [ 3.20 , 1.52 , 2.66 , 2.61 , 0.98 ]. Leg formula: 2413 . Copulatory organ (
Figs
4 I
–J
,
6 A–B
): Epigynal field transversally oval (
Figs
4 I
,
6 A
). Median septum broad over its entire length, with rectangular posterior pit (
Figs
4 I
,
6 A
). Rims around copulatory openings forming a large circle (
Fig 6 A
). Lateral loops of the internal duct system may or may not extend posteriorly to receptacula (
Figs 4 J
,
6 B
;
Jäger 2006
: figs 14, 15).

Note. According to
Jäger ( 2006 )
, the lateral loops of internal duct system of the female genitalia of
M. minuscula
extend posteriorly to the receptacula (
Jäger 2006 : figs 14, 15
). But in one of our female specimens, lateral loops of internal duct system extend posteriorly not to receptacula (
Figs 4 J
,
6 B
).

Natural history. Both male and females of
M. minuscula
were collected from leaf litter in a semi-deciduous and semi-evergreen forests floor.
